segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
segments.en: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mallikā devī kālaṅkatā hoti.
Atha kho aññataro puriso yena rājā pasenadi kosalo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rañño pasenadissa kosalassa upakaṇṇake āroceti:
segments.en: Then a man went up to the king and whispered in his ear,
“Your Majesty, Queen Mallikā has passed away.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, rājā pasenadi kosalo dukkhī dummano pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.
segments.en: When this was said, King Pasenadi was miserable and sad. He sat with his shoulders drooping, downcast, depressed, with nothing to say.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ dukkhiṃ dummanaṃ pattakkhandhaṃ adhomukhaṃ pajjhāyantaṃ appaṭibhānaṃ viditvā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Knowing this, the Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “pañcimāni, mahārāja, alabbhanīyāni ṭhānāni samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Great king, there are five things that cannot be had by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.

segments.pli: ‘Jarādhammaṃ mā jīrī’ti alabbhanīyaṃ ṭhānaṃ … pe … na socanāya paridevanāya … pe … kammaṃ daḷhaṃ kinti karomi dānī”ti.
segments.en: That someone liable to old age should not grow old. … Sorrowing and lamenting doesn’t do even a little bit of good … ‘The karma is strong. What can I do now?’”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: When King Pasenadi learns of the death of his beloved Queen Mallikā, the Buddha consoles him.
